name: Cymidei Cymeinfoll

attributes.attribute: gave rise to much of the action of the second branch of the Mabinogion
gave birth to innumerable armored warriors, once every six weeks

sources: Gantz, Jeffrey, trans. *The Mabinogion*. New York: Barnes & Noble Books, 1976, pp. 72, 75, 87.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Welsh legend tells of the valiant Cymidei Cymeinfoll, a woman of great strength who was married to the colossal Llassar Llaesgyfnewid. Together, they possessed the Cauldron of renewal, a key element in the second branch of the Mabinogion. Cymidei Cymeinfoll, whose name denotes her as a formidable combatant, bore an unending supply of fully armed soldiers every six weeks.
